name: Anger
description: The strong feeling you get when you think someone has treated you badly or unfairly, that makes you want to hurt them or shout at them

subEmotions.name: annoyed
subEmotions.description: Feeling slightly angry or impatient

subEmotions.name: frustrated
subEmotions.description: Feeling annoyed and impatient because you are prevented from achieving something

subEmotions.name: bitter
subEmotions.description: Feeling angry or upset because of a bad experience, especially when you think that you have been treated unfairly

subEmotions.name: infuriated
subEmotions.description: Extremely angry

subEmotions.name: mad
subEmotions.description: Enraged; greatly provoked or irritated

subEmotions.name: insulted
subEmotions.description: To feel angry and upset because of something that someone has said or done

subEmotions.name: vengeful
subEmotions.description: Wanting or trying to harm someone because they have done something bad to you

name: Fear
description: The feeling that you have when you are frightened

subEmotions.name: worried
subEmotions.description: Unhappy because you are thinking about your problems or about bad things that could happen

subEmotions.name: nervous
subEmotions.description: Feeling excited and worried, or slightly afraid

subEmotions.name: anxious
subEmotions.description: Worried because you think something bad might happen

subEmotions.name: scared
subEmotions.description: Frightened, or worried

subEmotions.name: panicked
subEmotions.description: To have a sudden strong feeling of fear or worry and be unable to think clearly or calmly or decide what to do

subEmotions.name: stressed
subEmotions.description: Affected by stress

name: Enjoyment
description: Enjoyment is a positive affective state that occurs when a person engages in an experience or activity that satisfies a desire, goal, or need, including but not limited to the need for pleasure, meaning, security, safety, sustenance, esteem, belongingness, or love

subEmotions.name: pleasure
subEmotions.description: A feeling of happiness, enjoyment, or satisfaction

subEmotions.name: joy
subEmotions.description: A feeling of great happiness

subEmotions.name: happiness
subEmotions.description: The feeling of being happy

subEmotions.name: amusement
subEmotions.description: A feeling of being amused

subEmotions.name: pride
subEmotions.description: A feeling of pleasure and satisfaction that you get when you, or someone connected with you, have achieved something special

subEmotions.name: awe
subEmotions.description: A feeling of great respect and admiration, often combined with fear

subEmotions.name: excitement
subEmotions.description: The feeling of being excited

subEmotions.name: ecstasy
subEmotions.description: A feeling of great happiness and pleasure, often sexual pleasure

name: Sadness
description: Sadness is an emotional pain associated with, or characterized by, feelings of disadvantage, loss, despair, grief, helplessness, disappointment and sorrow

subEmotions.name: lonely
subEmotions.description: Unhappy because you are alone or because you have no friends

subEmotions.name: unhappy
subEmotions.description: Feeling sad or upset, not satisfied

subEmotions.name: hopeless
subEmotions.description: Feeling or showing no hope

subEmotions.name: gloomy
subEmotions.description: Feeling sad and without hope

subEmotions.name: miserable
subEmotions.description: Extremely unhappy or uncomfortable

name: Disgust
description: A very strong feeling of not liking something

subEmotions.name: dislike
subEmotions.description: To not like someone or something

subEmotions.name: revulsion
subEmotions.description: An extreme feeling of disliking someone or something that is so unpleasant that you feel slightly ill

subEmotions.name: nauseated
subEmotions.description: Feeling as if you are going to vomit. The more usual phrase for this is to make someone feel sick

subEmotions.name: aversion
subEmotions.description: A strong feeling that you dislike someone or something

subEmotions.name: offended
subEmotions.description: Be upset and angry by actions of someone

subEmotions.name: horrified
subEmotions.description: Very shocked or frightened
